programme.title: Men's Canoe (C1) Semi-Final & Final | Canoe Slalom | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: This Men's Semi-Final and Final took place at Nautical St - White water, France, on 29/07/24. Nicolas Gestin (FRA) won Gold with a time of 91.36 seconds, Adam Burgess (GBR) won Silver, and Matej Benus (SVK) completed the podium.

programme.title: Single-minded Tasiadis embraces his new start in Germany
programme.desc: Greek-born slalom canoeist Sideris Tasiadis found the focus and drive to win Olympic silver after embracing his new German surroundings.

programme.title: Men's Team Gold Medal Match KOR - FRA | Archery | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: This Men's Team Gold Medal Match took place at Invalides, Paris, on 29/07/24. The Republic of Korea won the Gold Medal with a victory over France, who won Silver, 5:1

programme.title: How India’s top archer Deepika Kumari refused to give up
programme.desc: The incredible journey of India’s top archer from a childhood born in poverty to competing on the world’s highest stages. Though Rio ultimately ended in disappointment for Kumari, she’s not done yet.

programme.title: Jumping Team Final | Equestrian | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Jumping Team Final took place at Chateau de Versailles, Versailles, on 02/08/24. Great Britain won the Gold Medal, Unietd States won the Silver Medal, and France won Bronze.

programme.title: Tom Daley: 1.6 Seconds | Documentary
programme.desc: This feature documentary dives into the life of the UK’s diving legend. From Beijing 2008 to his gold medal in Tokyo 2020 and final Olympics in Paris 2024, Daley shares his personal journey, the pressures, losses, and triumphs that defined his career. Exclusive footage and candid moments reveal a story of resilience and growth.

programme.title: The Olympics On The Record | Episode 6
programme.desc: A new Trinidad star throws himself into the record books, Killy leaves his mark, oldest Olympians, and Kenyan Steeplechase dominance.

programme.title: Men's Trap Finals | Shooting | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Men's Trap Finals took place on 30/07/2024 at Chateauroux Shooting Centre. Nathan Hales (GBR) won Gold, Qi Ying (CHN) won Silver, and Jean Pierre Brol Cardenas (GUA) won Bronze.

programme.title: India’s Abhinav Bindra I Legends Live On
programme.desc: A look at the Olympic achievements of India’s first-ever individual gold medallist, Abhinav Bindra, and how he is now helping others fulfil their dreams.

programme.title: CHN - PRK - Mixed Doubles Finals | Table Tennis | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Finals beteween China v Democratic People's Republic of Korea took place at South Paris Arena 4 on 30/07/24. China won Gold with a final score CHN 4:2 PKR.

programme.title: Sports Swap: Table Tennis vs Hockey with Britt Eerland & Blair Tarrant
programme.desc: What happens when an Olympic hockey player and a Dutch table tennis champion swap sports?

programme.title: NZL v CAN Women's Gold Medal Match | Rugby | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Women's Gold Medal Match between New Zealand and Canada took place on 30/07/2024, at the Stade de France. New Zealand won Gold. Final Score NZL 19:12 CAN.

programme.title: Ilona Maher: From Heartbreak to Bronze | Wait For It Paris 2024
programme.desc: Ilona Maher’s journey from Olympic heartbreak in Tokyo to a hard-fought bronze in Paris is a powerful story of resilience, leadership, and redefining victory. With grit on the field and charisma off it, she emerged as a breakout star of rugby sevens, proving that Olympic success isn’t just measured in gold.

programme.title: Can USA's rugby coach Mike Friday transform India’s U17 female rugby team?
programme.desc: Team USA coach Mike Friday travels to Mumbai to train the Indian U17 Rugby 7's women's side, aiming to qualify for the Youth Olympics.

programme.title: Women's Team Final | Artistic Gymnastics | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Women's Team Final took place at the Bercy Arena, Paris, on 30/07/24. The United States of America won Gold, Italy won Silver and the Brazil finished the podium.

programme.title: Viktoriia: Ukraine’s Gymnastics Hope
programme.desc: As the bombs dropped in her hometown of Kyiv and her father left home to fight in the war, Ukrainian rhythmic gymnast Viktoriia Onopriienko battled daily to make her dream – competing in Paris 2024 – come true. This documentary showcases her grit, resilience and determination in her inspiring journey to compete at the Olympic Games. Discover the indomitable spirit of this young athlete as she prepares to represent Ukraine on the world stage.

programme.title: Mat 1: Women's -63kg, Men's -81kg Repechages/Semi-Finals/Finals | Judo | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Women's -63kg and Men's -81kg Finals took place on 30/07/2024 at the Champ-de-Mars Arena, Paris. At the Women's -63kg, Andreja Leski (SLO) claimed the Gold medal, Prisca Awiti Alcaraz (MEX) won the Silver, and the Bronze medals went to Laura Fazliu (KOS) and Clarisse Agbegnenou (FRA). At the Men's -81kg,Takanori Nagase (JPN) won the Gold medal, Tato Grigalashvili (GEO) took the Silver, and the Bronze medals went to Somon Makhmadbekov (TJK) and Joonhwan Lee (KOR).

programme.title: How Majlinda Kelmendi’s historic Olympic medal put Kosovo on the map
programme.desc: Majlinda Kelmendi’s gold medal in Rio put Kosovo on top of the podium for the first time soon after being welcomed into the Olympic family.

programme.title: Finals Piste: Women's Epee Team Bronze & Gold Medal Bouts | Fencing | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Women's Epee Team Finals took place on 30/07/2024 at the Grand Palais - Podium Piste. Italy won the Gold medal over France, who took Silver. Poland won the Bronze over China.

programme.title: Enzo Lefort's quest for individual gold at Paris 2024 | Athletes to Watch
programme.desc: Explore Enzo Lefort's journey from his Guadeloupean roots to the Paris 2024 Olympics, driven by his ambition for individual gold. Witness his rigorous training regimen and unwavering determination, fueled by past victories at World Championships and Olympic Games in the team events. As the Games draw near, Lefort's focus intensifies as he prepares to compete on home turf, aiming to etch his name in Olympic history with a triumphant performance in a memorable venue: le Grand Palais at the heart of Paris.

programme.title: Women's 100m Backstroke - Final | Swimming | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Women's 100m Backstroke was held on 30/07/2024 at Paris La Defense Arena. Kaylee McKeown (AUS) claimed Gold with an Olympic record time of 57.33 seconds, Regan Smith (USA) took Silver and Katharine Berkoff (USA) completed the podium.

programme.title: Men's 800m Freestyle - Final | Swimming | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Men's 800m Freestyle was held on 30/07/2024 at Paris La Defense Arena. Daniel Wiffen (IRL) claimed Gold with an Olympic record time of 7:38.19, Bobby Finke (USA) took Silver and Gregorio Paltrinieri (ITA) completed the podium.

programme.title: Men's 4x200m Freestyle Relay - Final | Swimming | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Men's 4x200m Freestyle was held on 30/07/2024 at Paris La Defense Arena. Great Britain claimed the Gold with a time of 6:59.43, The United States of America took Silver and Australia completed the podium.

programme.title: Michael Andrew, Team USA’s Record-Breaking Machine | Splash In
programme.desc: He was a teenager when he started breaking US national age group records. Over the course of his career, he broke more than 100 national records. At Tokyo 2020, he helped team USA break the world record in the 4 x 100 medley relay and won his first Olympic Gold. Soundtrack: Glass Animals, Heat Waves

programme.title: Molly Carlson, Canada’s Brave High Diver | Splash In
programme.desc: She started as a gymnast, then switched to diving, before specializing in high diving (20m) because that is what bravery is to her. Along the journey, she learned how to deal with mental health struggles, an experience that she now shares with her fans as a mental health advocate and founder of the #bravegang. Soundtrack: Bastille, Shut Off The Lights

programme.title: Melissa Wu, the Australian Olympic Diver Who Does Not Give Up | Splash In
programme.desc: At the age of 10 she knew that diving was the sport for her. Throughout her 16 years career, diving helped her overcome depression, anxiety, and lack of self-belief, until she won bronze in Tokyo 2020. Watch her story. Soundtrack: Bree Runway, Pressure.

programme.title: Izzy Thorpe and Kate Shortman, Team GB’s Promising Artistic Swimmers | Splash In
programme.desc: Their mothers competed together years ago, now Izzy and Kate are following in their footsteps. The two best friends are fully in synch in and out of the pool. Tokyo 2020 was their Olympic debut, and they are both looking forward to making a splash at Paris 2024. Soundtrack: Sigrid, Don’t Kill My Vibe

programme.title: Men's Individual All-Around Final | Artistic Gymnastics | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Men's All-Around Artistic Gymnastics Final took place on 31/07/2024 at the Bercy Arena, Paris. Shinnosuke Oka (JPN) claimed the Gold, Boheng Zhang (CHN) took the Silver, and Ruoteng Xiao (CHN) the Bronze.

programme.title: The Interruption
programme.desc: The COVID-19 pandemic rocks the gymnasts’ schedules. The Tokyo 2020 Olympic Games are heartbreakingly postponed. The three gymnasts remain determined to chase their Olympic dreams.

programme.title: KOR-HUN - Men's Sabre Team Gold Medal Bout | Fencing | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Men's Sabre Team Gold Medal Bout between The Republic of Korea and Hungary took place on 31/07/2024 at the Grand Palais. The South Korean team took the Gold medal, and the Hungarian one won Silver. Final Score KOR 45:41 HUN.

programme.title: Women's Trap Finals | Shooting | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Women's Trap Finals took place on 31/07/2024 at Chateauroux Shooting Centre. Adriana Ruano (GUA) won Gold, Silvana Stanco (ITA) won Silver, and Penny Smith (AUS) won Bronze.

programme.title: Viktoriia: Ukraine’s Gymnastics Hope
programme.desc: As the bombs dropped in her hometown of Kyiv and her father left home to fight in the war, Ukrainian rhythmic gymnast Viktoriia Onopriienko battled daily to make her dream – competing in Paris 2024 – come true. This documentary showcases her grit, resilience and determination in her inspiring journey to compete at the Olympic Games. Discover the indomitable spirit of this young athlete as she prepares to represent Ukraine on the world stage.

programme.title: The Olympics On The Record | Episode 10
programme.desc: Williams sisters wipe the floor, the King of Biathlon, a slalom surprise for Slovenia, road race close finish, and China's greatest star.

programme.title: Finals | Cycling BMX | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Cycling BMX Freestyle Finals took place on 31/07/2024 at La Concorde, Paris. In the Women's Final, Deng Yawen (CHN) took the Gold, Perris Benegas (USA) took the Silver, and Natalya Diehm (AUS) took the Bronze. In the Men's Final, Jose Torres Gil (ARG) won Gold, Kieran Darren David Reilly (GBR) won Silver, and Anthony Jeanjean (FRA) won Bronze.

programme.title: Women's Individual Time Trial | Cycling Road | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: Women's Individual Time Trial took place at Pont Alexandre III on the 27/07/24. Grace Brown (AUS) won the Gold Medal, Anna Henderson (GBR) won the Silver Medal, and Chloe Dygert (USA) won the Bronze Medal.

programme.title: Victoria Pendleton at age 26
programme.desc: By her mid-20s British track cyclist Victoria Pendleton was an international class rider but had yet to make an impression at Olympic level.

programme.title: Men's Final | Cycling BMX Racing | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc:
The Cycling BMX Racing Men's Finals took place on 02/08/2024 at Saint-Quentin-en-Yvelines BMX Stadium.
Joris Daudet (FRA) won Gold, Sylvain Andre (FRA) won Silver and Romain Mahieu (FRA) won Bronze.

programme.title: Women's Final | Cycling BMX Racing | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc:
The Cycling BMX Racing Women's Finals took place on 02/08/2024 at Saint-Quentin-en-Yvelines BMX Stadium.
Saya Sakakibara (AUS) won Gold, Manon Veenstra (NED) won Silver and Zoe Classens (SUI) won Bronze.

programme.title: The Olympics On The Record | Episode 10
programme.desc: Williams sisters wipe the floor, the King of Biathlon, a slalom surprise for Slovenia, road race close finish, and China's greatest star.

programme.title: India’s growing breaking scene makes room for B-Girls | Breaking Life
programme.desc: India’s Breaking scene started in the early 2000’s and has since exploded in popularity. While mostly male dominated, women are increasingly accepted and celebrated in the Indian Breaking scene. We meet B-Girl Jo, the two-time BC One India champion from Bangalore, as she travels alone to Mumbai. There, she meets her friend Flying Machine who organizes a community celebration event where B-Girls have a chance to battle it out. As a leader for Indian female hip-hop dancers, Jo reflects on her position in the society. With her own hip-hop and yoga studio and inspired by the challenges she’s already had to overcome, she examines her journey with both excitement and wisdom.

programme.title: Women's Cross-Country | Cycling Mountain Bike | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: Women's Cross-Country Final at Elancourt Hill, Paris, on 28/07/24. Pauline Ferrand Prevot (FRA) claimed the Gold, Haley Batten (USA) the Silver and Jenny Rissveds (SWE) the Bronze.

programme.title: Women's Omnium, Women's Sprint, Men's Keirin | Cycling Track | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc:
This session includes the Women's Omnium, the Women's Sprint and the Men's Keirin which took place at the Saint-Quentin-En-Yvelines Velodrome on 11/08/24.
The Men's Keirin was won by Harrie Lavreysen (NED) with Gold, Matthew Richardson (AUS) with Silver and Matthew Glaetzer (AUS) with Bronze.
The Women's Sprint was won by Ellesse Andrews (NZL) with Gold, Lea Friedrich (GER) with Silver and Emma Finucane (GBR) with Bronze.
The Women's Omnium was won by Jennifer Valente (USA) with Gold, Daria Pikulik (POL) with Silver and Ally Wollaston (NZL) with Bronze.

programme.title: The Olympics On The Record | Episode 10
programme.desc: Williams sisters wipe the floor, the King of Biathlon, a slalom surprise for Slovenia, road race close finish, and China's greatest star.

programme.title: India’s growing breaking scene makes room for B-Girls | Breaking Life
programme.desc: India’s Breaking scene started in the early 2000’s and has since exploded in popularity. While mostly male dominated, women are increasingly accepted and celebrated in the Indian Breaking scene. We meet B-Girl Jo, the two-time BC One India champion from Bangalore, as she travels alone to Mumbai. There, she meets her friend Flying Machine who organizes a community celebration event where B-Girls have a chance to battle it out. As a leader for Indian female hip-hop dancers, Jo reflects on her position in the society. With her own hip-hop and yoga studio and inspired by the challenges she’s already had to overcome, she examines her journey with both excitement and wisdom.

programme.title: Men's & Women's Sprint, Women's Madison | Cycling Track | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc:
This session contains the Men's Sprint Bronze Medal Final, the Men's Sprint Gold Medal Final, the Women's Madison Final and the Women's Sprint 1/16 Finals and Repechages which took place at the Saint-Quentin-En-Yvelines Velodrome on 09/08/24.
The Women's Madison was won by Consonni/Guazinni (ITA) with Gold, Barker/Evans (GBR) with Silver and van Belle/van der Duin (NED) with Bronze.
The Men's Sprint was won by Harrie Lavreysen (NED) with Gold, Matthew Richardson (AUS) with Silver and Jack Carlin (GBR) with Bronze.

programme.title: How recovery sparks hope for last "off-limits" town of Fukushima
programme.desc: Born and raised in Futaba, Olympic cyclist Kazunari Watanabe embarks on a personal journey to visit his home town for the first time since the earthquake.

programme.title: Kristina Vogel Cooks with Chef Marcello Fabbri.
programme.desc: German track cyclist champion Kristina Vogel learns how to prepare a gilt-head bream.

programme.title: Men's & Women's Sprint | Cycling Track | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: This session contains the Women's Sprint Qualifications, the Men's Sprint Semi-Finals, the Women's Sprint 1/32 Finals and the Women's Sprint 1/32 Finals Repechages which took place at the Saint-Quentin-En-Yvelines Velodrome on 09/08/24.

programme.title: From The Top Episode 2: Charlotte Worthington and The Vamps
programme.desc: Olympic BMX champion Charlotte Worthington meets one of her favourite bands, The Vamps. After attending their concert and hanging our backstage, she invites them for some action at the BMX park. Will they be up for the challenge?

programme.title: OQS Last Chance to Paris Linear | BMX
programme.desc: The best BMX Freestyle riders in the world come face to face at two tournaments that will seal their Olympic fates.
